definition: to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: This may imply world-weariness or a no-bullshit attitude.
sentences.chinese: 这可以暗示一种厌世的或者“少跟我装蒜”的态度。

sentences.english: Stop posing and tell us what you really think.
sentences.chinese: 别装蒜啦，告诉我们你的真实想法吧。

sentences.english: Come off it, Tom, we know you married her for money.
sentences.chinese: 别装蒜了，汤姆，我们都知道你与她结婚是为了钱。

sentences.english: How many people and things in their fragile lives could bear feigning ignorance or strangeness?
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的人生又能有多少人和事经得起装蒜与矜持？

definition: to act stupid/to pretend to be naive
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
to ask a question, already knowing the answer
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
to spit blood (idiom); venomous slander/malicious attacks
to sneer/to make cynical remarks/sarcastic talk
